summary: This is an email from an unspecified sender to Alex Acosta, then U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, regarding the Epstein case. The sender requests a de novo review of evidence and asks for copies of investigative materials, including FBI 302s and grand jury transcripts, to be provided as soon as possible.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: The email is addressed to him, requesting a de novo review of evidence and copies of investigative materials related to the proposed Epstein indictment.

events.title: Email Request for Epstein Evidence Review
events.description: An email is sent to Alex Acosta requesting a de novo review of evidence underlying the proposed Epstein indictment and asking for copies of investigative materials.

keyFacts: An email dated December 11, 2007, requests a de novo review of evidence for the proposed Epstein indictment.
The email is addressed to Alex Acosta, the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida at the time.
The sender asks for copies of FBI 302s, state grand jury materials, interview transcripts, and other underlying investigative information.
The reference to 'recent Kirkland & Ellis correspondence' suggests legal involvement or communication from that law firm in the case.
